question: Most common symptom in ectopic pregnancy -
exp: Ans. is 'a' i. e., Abdominal pain "Classical traid of symptoms of disturbed tubal pregnancy are:- Abdominal pain (100%), preceeded by amenorrhoea (75%) and lastly vaginal bleeding (70%)"Clinical features of acute ectopic pregnancy. Symptoms. Abdominal pain is the most constant feature. It is acute, agonising or colicky. Located in lower abdomen, may be unilateral, bilateral or generalized. Shoulder tip pain (25%preferred pain d/t diaphragmatic irritation by haemoperitoneum) may be present. Amenorrhoea of short period (6-8 weeks )usually. Sometimes may be absent. Vaginal bleeding may be slight and continuous. Vomiting and fainting attacks syncopal attack is due to reflex vasomotor disturbance following peritoneum irritation by haemoperitoneum. Signs. General look is diagnostic. Patient lies quite and conscious, perspires and looks blanched. Pallor is severe and proportionate to amount of internal bleeding. Shock rapid and feeble pulse, hypotension, cold and clammy extremities. Abdominal examination lower abdomen is tense and tender. Shifting dullness present and muscle guard is absent. Pelvic examination is may precipitate more bleeding due to manipulation.
